TEXT: The applicant , Mr Mueen Chishti , is an GPE national of NORP origin , born in DATE and residing in GPE , GPE ( USA ) .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

On DATE , the applicant was arrested in GPE . He was suspected , with CARDINAL other persons , of fraud , consisting in encoding information of credit cards , belonging to other people , on the magnetic bands of blank plastic cards using a personal computer and an encoding / decoding device . These plastic cards were then used at P.O.S. ( “ point of sale ” ) terminals , with the collaboration of their owners , to draw sums to be paid by the banks in question .
On DATE , ORG sentenced the applicant to DATE imprisonment for computer fraud ( burla informática ) , falsification of credit cards and corruption .
The applicant appealed to ORG ( Supremo Tribunal de Justiça ) complaining , inter alia , of a violation of his rights of defence .
In a judgment of DATE , served on the applicant on DATE , ORG rejected the appeal against conviction . It however reduced the sentence of the applicant to DATE ‘ imprisonment .
Some of the defendants , but not the applicant , appealed to ORG . According to the applicant , ORG gave its judgment in DATE .
After an initial period of detention at the prison of PERSON , the applicant was transferred , on DATE , to the prison of PERSON .

On DATE , a member of the prison staff handed back to the applicant a letter that he had written in GPE ( NORP ) to his family in GPE . It was explained to the applicant that he could not use the GPE language in his correspondence for “ security reasons ” .

On DATE , the applicant complained about the situation to the prison governor . He was then informed that some other letters that his family had send to him in GPE had been confiscated and filed in his individual file .

Following the subsequent complaints of the applicant concerning his impossibility to correspond in GPE , the prison governor requested , on DATE , advice from ORG . The ORG was unable to find in the individual file of the applicant , submitted by the Government at the ORG ’s request , any reply from ORG to the prison governor ’s request .
At DATE , the prison governor exceptionally authorised the applicant to send a letter in GPE to his parents in GPE .

According to the applicant , he registered his name twice to complain about the ban concerning his correspondence to the prison judge ( juíz de execução de penas ) but never had a reply . The ORG was however unable to find any of these alleged requests in the applicant ’s individual file .

Informed by the applicant , ORG offered , on DATE , its services in order to solve the problem . The ORG found a translator willing and able to translate from LANGUAGE into GPE and vice - versa , without costs to the applicant , all the necessary incoming and outgoing mail . According to the ORG , this solution would meet with the approval of the prison governor . However , in DATE , the applicant declined the offer .
The applicant was again authorised to send a letter in GPE at CARDINAL occasion , at DATE .
On DATE , the applicant was transferred to GPE to serve the remainder of his sentence .
On DATE the applicant was released conditionally .
The execution of prison sentences is regulated by LAW No CARDINAL/CARDINAL of DATE .

Section CARDINAL of this Decree PERSON provides , in its paragraph CARDINAL , that the prison governor can order the stopping of inmates’ outgoing and incoming mail if written in an unknown foreign language and without special reasons justifying the use of such language . The letters in question are filed in the individual file of the person concerned .

The provisions of LAW were supplemented by a Circular No CARDINAL/CARDINAL/DEP/CARDINAL issued by ORG on DATE . Under this Circular , correspondence is withheld only after being scrutinised in accordance with the provisions of Decree Law No CARDINAL/CARDINAL .

Inmates can submit complaints concerning the withholding of their correspondence , or any other matter , to the inspectors of ORG and to the prison judge . According to LAW No CARDINAL/CARDINAL , inmates should register their names in a special book in order to see the prison judge during the latter ’s DATE visits to the prison . The prison judge should then try to solve the matter in agreement with the prison governor . If there is no agreement , the issue is submitted to ORG of the prison in question ( Section CARDINAL ) . ORG is composed of the prison judge , who presides , the prison governor and CARDINAL other members of the prison staff . According to LAW , each of the members of ORG has a right of appeal against the ORG ’s decisions to the Minister of ORG .
